results.title: Broadway bound
results.creator_credit: Paul Bogart, Terry Nelson, ABC-TV (Australia) and a k a Productions
results.brief_description: This made for television production forms the third part of an “autobiographical” trilogy of the renowned American playwright Neil Simon - “Brighton Beach memoirs” being the first in the trilogy followed by “Biloxi blues”. Jonathan Silverman (Brighton Beach memoirs) returns as Eugene Jerome, Neil simon’s alter ego, while the role of Eugene’s older brother Stanley (played by Corey Parker) is based on Simon’s brother and early writing partner, Mel. The scene is set in Brighton Beach, New York in 1948 where three generations of the one family strive to live under the same roof. The Jerome brothers are attempting to fulfil their dreams of fame and fortune as comedy writers, the relationship between their mother Kate (Anne Bancroft) and father Jack (Jerry Orbach) is disintegrating rapidly and their aging grandfather Ben (Hume Cronyn) is faced with his own private dilemmas. The beauty of this film is in the witty and at times ascerbic script which is equally supported by superb performances from the cast as a whole. Screenplay by Neil Simon based on his play.

results.title: Broader concepts of curriculum
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Planning for Teaching”.
Shows American ideals of a broader education in living for adolescents, under the headings of civic competence, vocational orientation, preparation for family living, and health and physical fitness. High school students are seen as they elect their own leaders, and to research into social questions such as the power of pressure groups. Also shown are the types of vocational guidance and practical experience needed. Discussions on family problems, training for leisure, sport, are other elements of a broad curriculum.

results.title: Broadcast news (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: James L. Brooks, James L. Brooks Films, Gracie Films and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Three ambitious workaholics are set loose in a network TV newsroom where their professional and personal lives become hopelessly cross wired. Writer-director James L. Brooks is a filmmaker who is able to brilliantly combine comedy and drama with rich characters and unforgettable dialogue. His satire on the media can also be seen on ‘The Simpsons’ for which he is Executive Producer. He paints a savage, knowing, hilarious look at the television news industry and also what can happen to your personal life when your job consumes you. The performances are simply phenomenal. William Hurt gives depth to a dimbulb anchor, but Holly Hunter and Albert Brooks walk away with the movie. Cast includes Jack Nicholson (unbilled) and Joan Cusack. Music by Bill Conti.

results.title: Broad waterways
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Stewart McAllister and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A film about Britain’s channel system, concentrating on the North Eastern Division, based in Leeds. It shows the redevelopment of the channels, locks, and docks to increase the efficiency of water transportation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Stewart McAllister and British Transport Films

results.title: Broad shots
results.brief_description: Broad Shots was made by a group of young women from Broadmeadows as part of the Broadmeadows Healthy Localities Project, a local youth health promotion project. It looks at the issue of violence against young women through a series of interviews, skits and voxpops. “Broad Shots” is funny and fast and is a good starting point for discussion on domestic violence, sexual harassment and assertiveness. It is targeted at young people aged 13 to 16 years. Also contains appearances by comediennes Judith Lucy and Magda Szubanski.

results.title: Broad jump
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Amateur Athletic Union and United States Olympic Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “United World Track and Field”
Shows the development of the technique of broad jump, aka long jump, through to its correct conception and exercise. The balanced development of mobility and well performed athlete.

results.title: Broad daylight
results.creator_credit: Derrick Knight and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The development and use of patent glazing from Victorian times to the present day. Shows how patent glazing derived from the needs of expanding Victorian industry, and how it developed techniques so that today it remains completely adaptable to the demands of contemporary design.
